summary: This is a memorandum from the Bureau of Prisons Regional Director to the Warden of MCC New York, notifying them of an After Action Review team's arrival to investigate the apparent suicide of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. It lists the team members and requests staff cooperation and preparation of materials.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the After Action Review, identified as an inmate who died by apparent suicide at MCC New York.

events.title: After Action Review Team Arrival at MCC New York
events.description: A team of Bureau of Prisons staff arrives at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York to begin an investigation into the apparent suicide of inmate Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: The Bureau of Prisons formed an After Action Review team to investigate Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The team was scheduled to arrive at MCC New York on August 14, 2019, two days after this memo was written.
The memo instructs the warden to prepare materials, including videos and electronic records, for the team's independent review.
The memo advises the warden to notify the local union, indicating potential labor relations considerations during the investigation.
The investigative team was composed of senior staff from various BOP facilities and divisions, including health services, psychology, and correctional programs.
